qas.question: What was the birth date of John Von Neumann?
When did John Von Neuman die?
What were the occupations that Von Neuman held?

answers.text: pure and applied mathematician, physicist, inventor, computer scientist, and polymath

qas.question: What were Von Neuman's contributions to the field of computing?

answers.text: Von Neumann architecture, linear programming, self-replicating machines, stochastic computing

context: John von Neumann (/vɒn ˈnɔɪmən/; Hungarian: Neumann János Lajos, pronounced [ˈnɒjmɒn ˈjaːnoʃ ˈlɒjoʃ]; <a0_0>December 28, 1903<a0_0/> – <a1_0>February 8, 1957<a1_0/>) was a Hungarian-American <a2_0>pure and applied mathematician, physicist, inventor, computer scientist, and polymath<a2_0/>. He made major contributions to a number of fields, including mathematics (foundations of mathematics, functional analysis, ergodic theory, geometry, topology, and numerical analysis), physics (quantum mechanics, hydrodynamics, fluid dynamics and quantum statistical mechanics), economics (game theory), computing (<a3_0>Von Neumann architecture, linear programming, self-replicating machines, stochastic computing<a3_0/>), and statistics.
